2009/1/5 kentb <kentb@...>:
> Another way to look at this is to free ourselves from the fetters of Java
> syntax and semantics for a moment and imagine what we'd like to say about
> thrown exceptions, then map that back as best we can to the real programming
> language. I think I'd like to say something like:
>
> ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException isThrownBy new int[0][0]
>
> This is the essential information in the situation--an exception, an
> expression, and the declaration that the expression throws the exception.
> Now the game becomes how little noise do you need to add to get to
> syntactically correct Java. There is no one right answer.

There have been discussions about this since at least 2006:
http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/16313

Hopefully, it becomes less verbose with Java 7, if they really
introduce closures to the language...

Cheers, Ilja
